abstract: Hillary Rodham Clinton's presidential campaign has assembled imposing group of paid organizers in Iowa, outweighing staff size of any other candidate in state; reports opening 10 field offices and recruiting more than 7,000 volunteers in state where her 2008 efforts ended in disappointment.
lead_paragraph: “One of the things that I learned last time is it’s organize, organize, organize,” Hillary Rodham Clinton said recently. The state with the first nominating contest will be a proving ground for her campaign.

headline.main: Stung in 2008, Hillary Clinton Builds a Formidable Team in Iowa
headline.print_headline: Stung in 2008, Clinton Recruits Thousands of Organizers to Cover Iowa

snippet: “One of the things that I learned last time is it’s organize, organize, organize,” Hillary Rodham Clinton said recently. The state with the first nominating contest will be a proving ground for her campaign.
